SubTopics: Use numbers expressed in the form of a single digit times an integer power of 10 to estimate very large or very small quantities, and to express how many times as much one is than the other.
Content: A certain human red blood cell has a diameter of 0.000007 meters. Which expression represents this diameter, in meters, in scientific notation?

SubTopics: Describe qualitatively the functional relationship between two quantities by analyzing a graph (e.g., where the function is increasing or decreasing, linear or nonlinear). Sketch a graph that exhibits the qualitative features of a function that has been described verbally.
Content: A function has the following properties:

:box:• It is increasing and linear when the value of x is between –5 and –3.

• It remains constant when the value of x is between –3 and 0.

• It is decreasing and linear when the value of x is between 0 and 3.

• It is increasing and nonlinear when the value of x is between 3 and 5.
Which graph best represents this function?

SubTopics: Describe the two-dimensional figures that result from slicing three-dimensional figures, as in plane sections of right rectangular prisms and right rectangular pyramids.
Content: The figure shown below consists of a square pyramid on top of a cube. A vertical plane passes through point X and is perpendicular to the bases of both shapes, slicing the figure into equal halves.
problems/NY17G8M/media/3a.jpg
What shape is created by the intersection of the vertical plane and these three-dimensional shapes?

SubTopics: Construct a function to model a linear relationship between two quantities. Determine the rate of change and initial value of the function from a description of a relationship or from two (x, y) values, including reading these from a table or from a graph. Interpret the rate of change and initial value of a linear function in terms of the situation it models, and in terms of its graph or a table of values.
Content: Ms. Gibson made an initial deposit of $500 when opening a bank account. After the initial deposit, she deposited the same amount of money each month. The table below shows the total amount of money, a, she deposited into the account after a certain number of months, t, since opening it.
problems/NY17G8M/media/4a.jpg
Which equation models the relationship between a and t?

SubTopics: Understand that a two-dimensional figure is congruent to another if the second can be obtained from the first by a sequence of rotations, reflections, and translations; given two congruent figures, describe a sequence that exhibits the congruence between them.
Content: Triangle F and triangle G are shown below.
problems/NY17G8M/media/5a.jpg
Which sequence does not transform triangle F to triangle G?

A.Choice: a 180° clockwise rotation about the origin

B.Choice: a 180° counterclockwise rotation about the origin

C.Choice: a reflection over the x-axis and then a reflection over the y-axis

D.Choice: a reflection over the y-axis and then a 90° clockwise rotation about the origin

SubTopics: Interpret the equation y = mx + b as defining a linear function, whose graph is a straight line; give examples of functions that are not linear.
Content: Which statement explains the type of function that is represented by the equation y = x² + 9?

A.Choice: The function is linear because it contains more than one term.

B.Choice: The function is linear because the variable x is raised to the second power.

C.Choice: The function is nonlinear because it contains more than one term.

D.Choice: The function is nonlinear because the variable x is raised to the second power.

SubTopics: Understand that solutions to a system of two linear equations in two variables correspond to points of intersection of their graphs, because points of intersection satisfy both equations simultaneously.
Content: Line n is shown on the grid below.
problems/NY17G8M/media/7a.jpg
Line q will be graphed on the same grid. The only solution to the system of linear equations formed by lines n and q occurs when x = 3/2 and y = 0. Which equation could represent line q?

SubTopics: Compare properties of two functions each represented in a different way (algebraically, graphically, numerically in tables, or by verbal descriptions).
Content: The table represents linear Function F.
problems/NY17G8M/media/8a.jpg
The equation y = 4x + 2 represents Function G.
Which statement is true?

A.Choice: The rate of change of Function G is less than the rate of change of Function F because 2 < 3.

B.Choice: The rate of change of Function G is less than the rate of change of Function F because 4 < 9.

C.Choice: The rate of change of function G is greater than the rate of change of Function F because 2 > 9/7.

D.Choice: The rate of change of Function G is greater than the rate of change of Function F because 4 > 3.

SubTopics: Solve linear equations with rational number coefficients, including equations whose solutions require expanding expressions using the distributive property and collecting like terms.
Content: What is the solution to the equation shown below?

SubTopics: Use the equation of a linear model to solve problems in the context of bivariate measurement data, interpreting the slope and intercept.
Content: A company performed power tests on a set of batteries of the same type. The company determined that the equation y = 100 – 8.9x, where x is the number of hours of use and y is the percent of battery power remaining, models the battery life. Based on the equation, what is the best prediction of the percent of remaining power for a battery after 11 hours of use?

SubTopics: Graph proportional relationships, interpreting the unit rate as the slope of the graph. Compare two different proportional relationships represented in different ways.
Content: A cook uses 2.5 cups of flour for each ounce of butter in a recipe. Which graph represents the relationship between the amount of flour and the amount of butter in the recipe?

SubTopics: Solve real-world and mathematical problems leading to two linear equations in two variables.
Content: Two rectangles are shown below. Rectangle P has a perimeter of 20 inches. Rectangle Q has a perimeter of 30 inches.
problems/NY17G8M/media/18a.jpg
problems/NY17G8M/media/18b.jpg
What are the values of j and h?

SubTopics: Understand that patterns of association can also be seen in bivariate categorical data by displaying frequencies and relative frequencies in a two-way table. Construct and interpret a two-way table summarizing data on two categorical variables collected from the same subjects. Use relative frequencies calculated for rows or columns to describe possible association between the two variables.
Content: A school club had a T-shirt sale to raise money. After the sale, an inventory showed that 108 blue T-shirts and 96 green T-shirts had been sold. The sizes of these T-shirts included 60 small, 86 medium, and 58 large. Which table correctly represents these data?

SubTopics: Understand that a two-dimensional figure is similar to another if the second can be obtained from the first by a sequence of rotations, reflections, translations, and dilations; given two similar two-dimensional figures, describe a sequence that exhibits the similarity between them.
Content: The vertices of a triangle are located at F(-4, -2), G(2, 2), and H(0, -4). A sequence of transformations to triangle FGH results in triangle F'G'H', as shown below.
problems/NY17G8M/media/20a.jpg
Which sequence of transformations to triangle FGH results in triangle F'G'H'?

A.Choice: a 90° clockwise rotation about the origin, then a dilation by a scale factor of 2 with a center of dilation at the origin

B.Choice: a 90° counterclockwise rotation about the origin, then a dilation by a scale factor of 2 with a center of dilation at the origin

C.Choice: a 90° counterclockwise rotation about the origin, then a dilation by a scale factor of 1/2 with a center of dilation at the origin

D.Choice: a 90° clockwise rotation about the origin, then a dilation by a scale factor of 1/2 with a center of dilation at the origin

SubTopics: Know and apply the properties of integer exponents to generate equivalent numerical expressions.
Content: What is the value of n in the equation shown below?
:box:2² × 2ⁿ = (2⁴)³

SubTopics: Understand that a function is a rule that assigns to each input exactly one output. The graph of a function is the set of ordered pairs consisting of an input and the corresponding output.
Content: Which set of ordered pairs represents a function?

SubTopics: Describe the effect of dilations, translations, rotations, and reflections on two-dimensional figures using coordinates.
Content: A parallelogram with vertices at (0, 3), (2, 0), (4, 2), and (2, 5) is reflected over the y-axis. Which vertex of the parallelogram will have the same x-coordinate before and after the reflection?

SubTopics: Describe qualitatively the functional relationship between two quantities by analyzing a graph (e.g., where the function is increasing or decreasing, linear or nonlinear). Sketch a graph that exhibits the qualitative features of a function that has been described verbally.
Content: The graph of a function is shown below.
problems/NY17G8M/media/27a.jpg
Which statement is true about a section of the graph?

A.Choice: In Section N, the function is linear and decreasing.

B.Choice: In Section P, the function is linear and increasing.

C.Choice: In Section Q, the function is nonlinear and decreasing.

D.Choice: In Section R, the function is nonlinear and increasing.

SubTopics: Use the equation of a linear model to solve problems in the context of bivariate measurement data, interpreting the slope and intercept.
Content: The owner of a coffee shop compared the amount of hot coffee per day, in fluid ounces, sold and the daily high temperature, in degrees Fahrenheit, per day. Her data are shown in the scatter plot below.
problems/NY17G8M/media/28a.jpg
If these data are modeled by the line y = –5.9x + 850, which statement best describes a valid prediction the owner could make?

A.Choice: For each temperature increase of 10°F, the shop can expect to sell about 60 fluid ounces more hot coffee.

B.Choice: For each temperature increase of 10°F, the shop can expect to sell about 6 fluid ounces more hot coffee.

C.Choice: On a day with a high temperature of 0°F, the shop can expect to sell about 145 fluid ounces of hot coffee.

D.Choice: On a day with a high temperature of 0°F, the shop can expect to sell about 850 fluid ounces of hot coffee.

SubTopics: Understand that a two-dimensional figure is congruent to another if the second can be obtained from the first by a sequence of rotations, reflections, and translations; given two congruent figures, describe a sequence that exhibits the congruence between them.
Content: Squares PQRS and TUVW are shown below.
problems/NY17G8M/media/29a.jpg
Which sequence of transformations of square PQRS shows that square PQRS is congruent to square TUVW?

A.Choice: a translation 2 units up and 2 units to the right, then a reflection over the x-axis

B.Choice: a translation 2 units up and 2 units to the right, then a reflection over the y-axis

C.Choice: a translation 2 units down and 2 units to the left, then a reflection over the x-axis

D.Choice: a translation 2 units down and 2 units to the left, then a reflection over the y-axis

SubTopics: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, volume and surface area of two- and three-dimensional objects composed of triangles, quadrilaterals, polygons, cubes, and right prisms.
Content: Two types of shipping boxes are shown below.
problems/NY17G8M/media/30a.jpg
problems/NY17G8M/media/30b.jpg
What is the difference in the surface areas, in square feet, of the two boxes?

SubTopics: Know and apply the properties of integer exponents to generate equivalent numerical expressions.
Content: Which expression is equivalent to 2² × (2/2⁴)?

SubTopics: Know the formulas for the volumes of cones, cylinders, and spheres and use them to solve real-world and mathematical problems.
Content: The object below was made by placing a cone on top of a cylinder. The base of the cone is congruent to the base of the cylinder.
problems/NY17G8M/media/32a.jpg
What is the volume, in cubic centimeters, of the object?

SubTopics: Verify experimentally the properties of rotations, reflections, and translations.
Content: Lily wants to define a transformation (or series of transformations) using only rotations, reflections, or translations that takes Figure A to Figure B.
problems/NY17G8M/media/34a.jpg
Which statement about the transformation that Lily wants to define is true?

A.Choice: It can be defined with two reflections.

B.Choice: It can be defined with one rotation and one translation.

C.Choice: It cannot be defined because Figure A and Figure B are not congruent.

D.Choice: It cannot be defined because the longest side of Figure B is on the bottom.

SubTopics: Solve systems of two linear equations in two variables algebraically, and estimate solutions by graphing the equations. Solve simple cases by inspection.
Content: What is the solution to the system of equations below?

SubTopics: Construct and interpret scatter plots for bivariate measurement data to investigate patterns of association between two quantities. Describe patterns such as clustering, outliers, positive or negative association, linear association, and nonlinear association.
Content: As part of a training program for a triathlon, Marcie completes a three-mile run a few times each week. The scatter plot below shows the times in which Marcie completes this run for each week that she has been in the training program.
problems/NY17G8M/media/36a.jpg
Based on these data, which statement best describes the relationship between the number of weeks Marcie has been in the training program and her running times?

A.Choice: There is a negative linear association with no outliers.

B.Choice: There is a negative linear association with one outlier.

C.Choice: There is a positive linear association with no outliers.

D.Choice: There is a positive linear association with one outlier.

SubTopics: Solve linear equations with rational number coefficients, including equations whose solutions require expanding expressions using the distributive property and collecting like terms.
Content: What is the solution to the equation below?

SubTopics: Understand that a function is a rule that assigns to each input exactly one output. The graph of a function is the set of ordered pairs consisting of an input and the corresponding output.
Content: Which statement best explains whether these ordered pairs represent a function?

A.Choice: The ordered pairs represent a function because no output values are repeated.

B.Choice: The ordered pairs represent a function because each output value is greater than each input value.

C.Choice: The ordered pairs do not represent a function because one input value has two different output values.

D.Choice: The ordered pairs do not represent a function because the difference between the input and output of each ordered pair is not the same.

SubTopics: Solve real-world and mathematical problems leading to two linear equations in two variables.
Content: The amount of revenue in dollars, y, that Jason receives from selling x posters is given by the equation y = 4x. The cost of producing x posters is given by the equation y = (1/2)x + 280. How many posters does Jason need to sell so that the cost and revenue are equal?

SubTopics: Construct a function to model a linear relationship between two quantities. Determine the rate of change and initial value of the function from a description of a relationship or from two (x, y) values, including reading these from a table or from a graph. Interpret the rate of change and initial value of a linear function in terms of the situation it models, and in terms of its graph or a table of values.
Content: A car traveled 36 miles in 45 minutes. The car traveled at a constant speed. If the car continues to travel at this rate, which equation can be used to determine y, the total number of miles the car will travel, in x hours?

SubTopics: Perform operations with numbers expressed in scientific notation, including problems where both decimal and scientific notation are used. Use scientific notation and choose units of appropriate size for measurements of very large or very small quantities (e.g., use millimeters per year for seafloor spreading). Interpret scientific notation that has been generated by technology.
Content: The mass of a dust particle is approximately 7.5 × 10⁻¹⁰ kilograms and the mass of an electron is 9.1 × 10⁻³¹ kilograms. Approximately how many electrons have the same mass as one dust particle?

SubTopics: Compare properties of two functions each represented in a different way (algebraically, graphically, numerically in tables, or by verbal descriptions).
Content: Two photographers offer different pricing plans for their services. The graph below models the prices Photographer A charges. The table below shows the prices Photographer B charges. Each photographer charges a one-time equipment fee and an hourly rate.
problems/NY17G8M/media/43a.jpg
problems/NY17G8M/media/43b.jpg
Which statement about the two pricing plans is true?

A.Choice: Photographer A charges $15 per hour more than Photographer B.

B.Choice: Photographer B charges $15 per hour more than Photographer A.

C.Choice: Photographer A's equipment fee is $25 less than Photographer B's.

D.Choice: Photographer B's equipment fee is $25 less than Photographer A's.

SubTopics: Understand that a two-dimensional figure is similar to another if the second can be obtained from the first by a sequence of rotations, reflections, translations, and dilations; given two similar two-dimensional figures, describe a sequence that exhibits the similarity between them.
Content: Acute △ABC is rotated about a point and then dilated by a scale factor of 1/2 to produce △A'B'C'. Which statement correctly compares △A'B'C' to △ABC?

A.Choice: The angle measures and side lengths of △A'B'C' are half the size of those of △ABC.

B.Choice: The angle measures of △A'B'C' are the same as those of △ABC, but the side lengths of △A'B'C' are half the size of those of △ABC.

C.Choice: The angle measures of △A'B'C' are the same as those of △ABC, but the side lengths of △A'B'C' are twice the size of those of △ABC.

D.Choice: The angle measures of △A'B'C' depend on the angle of rotation, but the side lengths of △A'B'C' are half the size of those of △ABC.

SubTopics: Perform operations with numbers expressed in scientific notation, including problems where both decimal and scientific notation are used. Use scientific notation and choose units of appropriate size for measurements of very large or very small quantities (e.g., use millimeters per year for seafloor spreading). Interpret scientific notation that has been generated by technology.
Content: Which expression is equivalent to (4.5 × 10²) + (6.0 × 10³) and written in scientific notation?

SubTopics: Interpret the equation y = mx + b as defining a linear function, whose graph is a straight line; give examples of functions that are not linear.
Content: The points (2, –2) and (–4, 13) lie on the graph of a linear function of x. Which point also lies on the graph of this function?

SubTopics: Give examples of linear equations in one variable with one solution, infinitely many solutions, or no solutions. Show which of these possibilities is the case by successively transforming the given equation into simpler forms, until an equivalent equation of the form x = a, a = a, or a = b results (where a and b are different numbers).
Content: What value for the constant, h, in the equation shown below will result in an infinite number of solutions?

SubTopics: Graph proportional relationships, interpreting the unit rate as the slope of the graph. Compare two different proportional relationships represented in different ways.
Content: The graphs below show the relationship between elapsed time and distance traveled by airplane A and airplane B after each airplane reaches its cruising speed.
problems/NY17G8M/media/50a.jpg
problems/NY17G8M/media/50b.jpg

Airplane C is traveling at a different cruising sped. The equation y = (27/6)x can be used to determine y, the number of miles traveled by airplane C in x minutes. Which statement accurately compares the cruising speed of airplane C to airplanes A and B?

A.Choice: The cruising speed of airplane C is less than the cruising speeds of both airplanes A and B.

B.Choice: The cruising speed of airplane C is greater than the cruising speeds of both airplanes A and B.

C.Choice: The cruising speed of airplane C is greater than the cruising speed of airplane A and less than the cruising speed of airplane B.

D.Choice: The cruising speed of airplane C is less than the cruising speed of airplane A and greater than the cruising speed of airplane B.

SubTopics: Understand that a two-dimensional figure is similar to another if the second can be obtained from the first by a sequence of rotations, reflections, translations, and dilations; given two similar two-dimensional figures, describe a sequence that exhibits the similarity between them.
Content: Two transformations are performed on a figure on a coordinate plane. The first transformation is a translation 8 units to the left. Which second transformation will result in an image that is similar to, but not congruent to, the original figure?

A.Choice: a clockwise rotation of 90° about the center

B.Choice: a clockwise rotation of 180° about the center

C.Choice: a dilation by a scale factor of 1 with the origin as the center of dilation

D.Choice: a dilation by a scale factor of 1/2 with the origin as the center of dilation
